trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error occurs while serializing a security message.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityMessageSerializationException"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
Property
Value
`null`.
The localized error message string.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityMessageSerializationException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property of the new exception using the `message` parameter.
The content of `message` is intended to be understood by humans.
The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
Property
Value
`null`.
The error message string.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityMessageSerializationException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object that holds the serialized object data.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> object that contains the contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.SecurityMessageSerializationException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for the new instance.
Property
Value
The inner exception reference.
The error message string.
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that is the cause of the current exception.
If the innerException parameter is not `null`, the current exception is raised in a `catch` block that handles the inner exception.
